annotation: Grasp a small object which may be completely held in the hand (Fbg)
grasp it, take hold of it, retain it, hold fast to it
grasp it, take hold of it, retain it, hold fast to it
to hold in hand, to touch

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect
Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: The prenasalization is a morphematic feature
1. To hold; touch; handle; to manage or be in charge of s.t.
2. To hold something in a closed hand
3. To hold something on one's closed fist
4. To hold  s.t. or s. o in the palm of one's hand or hands
static hold (PAN gem ?)/ grab/ grab a bunch
Draw or bunch together, roll up (as sleeves), ruck up, grab (Bse)
Take hold of  Reach for (as for fish in a hole)
usually in compounds (tang gêtê, tang re)
L? Cf Squliq with [g] for Sediq [ŋ]. -EG
to carry or hold hanging from the hand
<i vaturia> means 'he/she holds it'. <i> = 3sg subject marker; <va-> = causative prefix; <tur> = 'to stand'; <-ia> = 3sg object enclitic
Catch a thrown object in the hands (Rch)
last n could be a u
last n could be a u
WP: tòrge, wòpa L: nèro, nòto VL: nàro, naka-ni VLP: taro-na, naro-na WB: màdo
